channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.description:
Report X-2023111312

item.title: Report X-2023111311
item.description:
Report X-2023111311

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: LAKELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS LOCATED NEAR LOADING BAY 1 LEAKING; THE PACKAGE WAS REMOVED FROM THE AREA AND HANDLED IN THE DMP AREA. THE ITEM INSIDE CONTAINS A METAL BUCKET HAVING A DIAMOND HAZARDOUS LABEL FLAMMABLE LIQUID CLASS 3 UN1993. THE BUCKET APPEARED TO BE USED WITH THE METAL LID TO BE CORRODE AND BENT INWARD. THE LIQUID IN THE TRAILER WAS ABOSRB TO THE BEST OF ITS ABILTY BUT THE SOME SOAKED INTO THE WOODEN FLOORING, AND MANGAMENT DELT WITH TRAILER LOADING PROCESS.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet box found during outbound shift. Box was placed into a plastic bag and brought to cage. Inspection found caps loose on the bottles and liquid leaked out. DescribePack: Loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box and contents were placed in a hazmat bag and salvage drum.

Upon inspection found 2 bottles of Diversey glance hc glass & multi-surface cleaner 1.5-liter had defective lids/nozzles resulted to leakage. Lids were secured but still leaked. DescribePack: Bottles had defective lids/nozzles resulted to leakage. Lids were secured but still leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

DescribePack: One of the two jugs in the box leaked contents during sortation, wetting the box and causing the flaps to open, spilling the bottles. The leaking bottle was not found. item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was unloaded from trailer and moved onto a tugger cart where it is believed to have been damaged, after reaching its van line it was deemed damaged after powder was noticed seeping out. upon inspection it was visibly damaged at the bottom with a crack running through. DescribePack: failure was at the bottom of the bucket and appears to have been cracked when being moved around the facility DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: contained in hazmat bin and placed upright to prevent any further leakage

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: pkg. was received damaged off trailer, taken to QA cage for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspecting contents, it was noted that 1 of the 2 plastic containers had a loose cap, causing liquid to leak out. There were no inside protection, orientation arrows on box. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. sitting in HMWA, awaiting instructions from PGH.

item.title: Report X-2023110777
item.description:
Report X-2023110777

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-04
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: An admin discovered the leaking HazMat on a driver's van during VSA. He put it in a red tote along with a bag. He then put it inside the HazMat Cage and sent an email about it. DescribePack: One cap was almost off from one jug. Another jug was missing the upper part of its cap. The box was soaked and torn apart on the bottom. Jugs fell out due to spill. No seals under caps. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The admin moved the leaking HazMat off the van and onto a red tote with a bag. It was then moved to the HazMat Cage.

item.title: Report X-2023110704
item.description:
Report X-2023110704

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package went out for delivery and the driver brought it back to the station for inspection. Then it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further inspection and containment. DescribePack: The 5 gal plastic pail of Aqua Org Plus calcium hypochlorite granules was shipped inside a box. The plastic pail has a large crack on the bottom causing it to spill inside the shipping box. About 30 ounces were released. No padding or inner packing materials were used. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a hazmat bag and bin when it came back to the station, for further containment. No release was found.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was seen on the IC belt with a wet spot and hole near the top corner. It was taken off and inspected in the Damages Area to determine if something else had leaked on the box. It was then put into a HazMat tote and HazMat bag after the leak was found. DescribePack: One plastic jug had its cap loose within the box. The seal under the cap was coming off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was moved into the HazMat tote and HazMat bag before being placed inside the HazMat Cage.

item.title: Report X-2023110422
item.description:
Report X-2023110422

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/23/2023 at approxiamtely 1659, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5190395 at the ramp facility in Miami, reporting a UN 3373 spill. The shipment consisted an estimated ten specimens packaged in a fiberbaord box labeled as "UN 3373". One of the specimen was contained in a plastic jar with a screw-on lid. The lid on the jar was discovered loose and the liquid containing animal tissue spilled. The lid was secured back onto the container and the shipment is being held for customer pick-up. Per policy, the shipment was reported to the the National Response Center.

  • Description: X-2023111008- CUSTOMER DROPPED OFF PRE-LABELED PKG. AT CUSTOMER CENTER. CONTENTS WERE INSPECTED DUE TO ON-GOING INVESTIGATION. INNER CONTENTS REVEAL SODIUM BOROHYDRIDE, 99% ACS GRADE. RESPONDER NOTED THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. X-2023111009-CUSTOMER DROPPED OFF PRE-LABELED PKG, AT CUSTOMER CENTER. CONTENTS WERE INSPECTED BY EMPLYEE DUE TO ON-GOING INVESTIGATION. DISCOVERED UNDECLARED HAZMAT.

item.title: Report X-2023110649
item.description:
Report X-2023110649

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver found box loaded on its side or upside down on delivery truck (ISP sent pictures to P&D) in relation to the printed directional arrows on the box. Driver tried to isolate box from other packages to reduce the possibility of additional damages. Driver gave package to QA when he returned to the station. DescribePack: Package was only marked with printed directional arrows, no Hazmat or Limited Quantity diamonds. 2 1gal cans of Trident Hurricane Cat 5 inside box with styrofoam liners for the tops and bottoms of the cans and 3 paint-can clips securing the lids. Package was loaded to delivery truck on its side or upside down causing one of the paint-can clips to come off and the lid to come loose on 1 can. All liquid spilled into the box and into the delivery truck. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Driver isolated package from other boxes and gave to QA when he returned. Package was placed on cardboard scrap to prevent liquid from spreading. After SDS was found listing product as Hazardous, box and cardboard were placed in a lined red hazmat bin.

item.title: Report I-2023090165
item.description:
Report I-2023090165

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T00:34:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FRONTIER AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0815 EDT the captain on inbound flight FFT1167 was taxing into gate 15 at Orlando International Airport (MCO) and called Ops and stated, "we have a fire". Ops notified the Comm Center and the airport fire department, which met the aircraft at the gate. We got the approval to pull the bridge up to the aircraft as it was advised the fire was out. The fire department entered the aircraft and determined it was safe to deplane the passengers. A woman, seated in row 7, tote bag began to smoke and catch on fire. The tote bag had a vape pen, a loose spare battery and a laptop in the tote bag. The flight attendants were quick to respond with a fire extinguisher and a fire containment bag and were able to put the fire out as fast as possible by using the fire containment bag to place the tote bag in it to stop the fire. The tote bag sustained heavy damage. Determined the tote bag contained a vape pen, a loose spare battery, and a laptop. Unsure if the vape pen or the loose battery began the thermal runaway as both were heavily damaged. The laptop was in the early stages of melting. There was no damage to the aircraft nor injured passengers on board. The fire department collected the fire containment bag with the tote bag in it. The passenger did eventually collect her laptop that was in the bag after speaking with the fire department and Frontier security.
